Description: Terracotta cooking stove fragment. A pot-support broken from a cooking-stove, completely plain, with a plain panel above. The back is decorated with a row of applied studs below a ridge; below again are four large dentils; part of the bowl and its heavily ridged rim survive. The support and panel were probably handmodelled on a wheel-made fire-bowl. Micaceous red-brown Nile silt with a brown and red core; inner surface and support burnt black. Traces of a red slip.
Curator's comments: Published (Conze 1890: 133, no. 898; Walters 1903: C 901; Şahin 2001: 123, figs 125 and 126: Na 16). Şahin, M. 2001. Hellenistic braziers in the British Museum: Trade contacts between ancient Mediterranean cities. Anatolian Studies 51: 91-132.
Bibliographic references: Terracotta / Catalogue of Terracottas in the British Museum (C901)
Şahin 2001 / Hellenistic braziers in the British Museum: Trade contacts between ancient Mediterranean cities (p.123, figs 125 and 126: Na 16)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (LA.37) (Phase 3)
